item.title: 本·布莱克携美国贷款机构进军华尔街，纽约办公室正式启用
item.description: 美国国际开发金融公司（总部位于华盛顿）在资金规模翻三倍后，正于华尔街开设办事处，以吸引更多私营部门人才并促成更多交易。【原文：Fresh from a tripling of its financial resources, the Washington-based US International Development Finance Corp. is opening a Wall Street office to lure more private-sector talent and deals.】

item.title: 阿波罗称投机者削减押注，日元套利头寸面临平仓风险
item.description: 阿波罗管理公司的托尔斯滕·斯洛克表示，日元套利交易存在平仓风险，并援引了近期投机性期货头寸的剧烈波动作为依据。【原文：Apollo Management’s Torsten Slok said there’s a risk of the yen carry trade unwinding, citing recent sharp moves in speculative futures positioning.】

item.title: 埃尔多拉多黄金公司以28亿美元收购福兰公司，最新矿业交易在金属狂潮中达成
item.description: 埃尔多拉多黄金公司同意以38亿加元（约合28亿美元）收购专注于铜矿业务的福兰矿业公司。这是矿业公司寻求提升金属产量后最新的一起行业合并案，此前金属价格在过去一年中大幅上涨。【原文：Eldorado Gold Corp. agreed to buy copper-focused Foran Mining Corp. for C$3.8 billion ($2.8 billion), the latest industry tie-up as miners seek to ramp up metals production after a massive price rally over the past year.】

item.title: 《圣保罗页报》报道：卢拉计划在2026年巴西大选中传递"反建制"信息
item.description: 据《圣保罗页报》报道，巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦正考虑在2026年竞选活动中采用自己的"反建制"话语，将"重建"巴西的主题转向聚焦金融精英阶层。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is considering adopting his own “anti-establishment” discourse in his 2026 election campaign, replacing his theme of “rebuilding” Brazil with a focus on the financial elite, according to Folha de S.Paulo.】

item.title: 保时捷CEO考虑削减电动跑车以应对预算问题
item.description: 据知情人士透露，保时捷公司正考虑搁置电动跑车产品线，以削减因其过于雄心勃勃的电动汽车战略而激增的成本。【原文：Porsche AG is considering shelving an electric sports car line to cut costs that have ballooned due its overly ambitious EV bet, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 苹果新款AirTag追踪器性能更优，但不值得升级
item.description: 苹果公司推出的第二代AirTag追踪器，本质上是对初代产品的轻量升级。单件售价29美元，四件套99美元，定价与前代保持一致。升级用户将获得更远的无线传输距离、更响亮的提示音，以及通过Apple Watch定位物品的功能——无需iPhone即可实现。【原文：Apple Inc.’s new second-generation AirTag is basically a slightly better do-over of the original. At $29 for a single item tracker or $99 for a four-pack, it also costs the same. Upgraders can expect slightly better wireless range, a louder chime and the ability to pinpoint an item’s location with their Apple Watch: no iPhone necessary.】

item.title: 美国制造业活动创2022年以来最大增幅
item.description: 美国制造业活动在1月份意外扩张，增速达到2022年以来最快水平，这得益于新订单和产量的强劲增长。【原文：US manufacturing activity unexpectedly expanded in January at the fastest pace since 2022, energized by solid growth in new orders and production.】

item.title: 美国股市表现平淡，沃什提名持续拖累市场
item.description: 周一美国股市表现平淡，投资者持续讨论特朗普总统提名凯文·沃什出任美联储主席一事，同时也在分析最新财报数据。【原文：US stocks were muted on Monday as investors continued to debate President Donald Trump picking Kevin Warsh to lead the Federal Reserve and parsed over the latest earnings.】

item.title: 印度航空因飞行员报告燃油开关故障停飞波音客机
item.description: 印度航空公司在一份声明中表示，因飞行员报告燃油控制开关可能存在缺陷，该公司已停飞一架波音787-8型飞机。【原文：Air India Ltd. grounded a Boeing 787-8 aircraft after the pilot flagged a possible defect related to its fuel control switch, the airline said in a statement.】

item.title: mBank称游戏股抛售背后的人工智能担忧被夸大了
item.description: mBank SA分析师表示，近期游戏开发商股票的抛售——源于市场对谷歌Project Genie人工智能工具可能引发行业颠覆的担忧——实属"毫无根据"。【原文：The recent selloff in video-game developer stocks — tied to fears of disruption from Google’s Project Genie AI tool — is “unjustified,” mBank SA analysts said.】

item.title: 据称，阿瑞斯二级基金部门将投资威尼斯机场项目
item.description: 阿瑞斯管理公司正牵头一个银团，为芬因特基础设施公司提供资金。该公司在收购威尼斯马可波罗机场所有者的两家企业中占据一席。【原文：Ares Management Corp. is leading a syndicate that’s providing capital to Finint Infrastrutture, one of two firms that acquired the owner of Venice’s Marco Polo Airport.】

item.title: 为何连一丝"卖美国"的暗示都令全球市场动荡不安
item.description: 美国拥有全球最深厚、流动性最强的金融市场。美元是货币之王。美国国债是最卓越的避险资产。然而，一种观点正逐渐占据上风：全球投资者或许该"抛售美国"了。【原文：The US boasts the world’s deepest and most liquid financial markets. The dollar is the king of currencies. Treasuries are the preeminent safe-haven asset. And yet, a narrative has taken hold that it may be time for global investors to “Sell America.”】

item.title: 佛罗里达州寒潮侵袭柑橘作物，电力供应面临压力
item.description: 佛罗里达州将至少再经历一天严寒天气，这场寒潮已对该州的柑橘作物造成损害，并促使当地一家公用事业公司呼吁居民减少用电。【原文：Florida will endure at least another day of bitter cold that has damaged the state’s citrus crop and prompted a local utility to ask residents to reduce electricity use.】

item.title: 英国担忧"欧洲制造"计划将冲击汽车、科技及绿色产业
item.description: 英国政府日益担忧，欧盟推行更多保护主义政策可能将英国企业排除在关键领域的供应链之外，这将破坏英国脱欧后与欧盟关系的重置进程，并可能使企业损失数十亿英镑。【原文：The UK government is increasingly concerned that more protectionist policies pursued by the European Union could exclude British companies from supply chains in key sectors, derailing a reset in post-Brexit relations and potentially costing firms billions of pounds.】

item.title: 铜价下跌促使花旗银行获利了结赞比亚克瓦查头寸
item.description: 全球铜价回落促使花旗集团暂时平仓其在赞比亚克瓦查货币上的头寸。【原文：The global copper price retreat has led Citigroup Inc. to close its position on Zambia’s kwacha currency for now.】

item.title: 先锋集团最新降费，平均费率降至0.06%
item.description: 先锋集团对其旗下共同基金和交易所交易基金产品线实施新一轮费用下调，进一步加剧了本就以低成本著称的基金行业的竞争压力。【原文：Vanguard Group has unleashed another round of fee cuts across its lineup of mutual funds and exchange-traded funds, further tightening the screws on an industry already known for its low costs.】

item.title: 兰德反弹为金属市场企稳后重启涨势铺路
item.description: 南非兰特周一反弹，此前该货币遭遇了自4月关税风波以来最严重的抛售。投资者认为，兰特将重启升势——过去一年间，正是这波涨势使其成为新兴市场货币中表现最亮眼的货币之一。【原文：South Africa’s rand rebounded on Monday after the worst selloff since the tariff turmoil in April, and investors see the currency resuming gains that have made it one of the best performers among emerging-market peers over the past year.】

item.title: 南非私人投资计划随改革推进增至三倍
item.description: 根据南非国民银行集团有限公司的报告，去年南非计划资本投资激增，私人投资承诺额翻了三倍，而政府项目（不含国有企业）有所减少。【原文：Planned capital investment in South Africa surged last year as private commitments tripled, while government projects excluding state companies declined, according to a report by Nedbank Group Ltd.】

item.title: 可可价格跌至三年低点，积压库存拖累市场
item.description: 可可期货价格延续跌势，跌至2023年11月以来的最低水平，主要生产商正努力为其产品寻找足够的买家。【原文：Cocoa futures extended declines to their lowest level since November 2023 as top producers struggle to find enough buyers for their output.】

item.title: 美国国债价格上涨，投资者寻求避险资产以应对风险资产下跌
item.description: 美国国债多数期限小幅走高，因贵金属暴跌引发的避险需求蔓延至其他市场。【原文：Treasuries edged higher across most maturities, fueled by demand for havens after a plunge in precious metals spilled over into other markets.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦亿万富豪考虑发行美元债和人民币债以筹集增长资金
item.description: 亿万富翁蒂穆尔·图尔洛夫正考虑发行美元和人民币计价债券，其旗下的自由控股公司正扩大业务规模，以与哈萨克斯坦主流金融机构展开竞争。【原文：Billionaire Timur Turlov is weighing debt sales in dollars and the yuan as his Freedom Holding Corp. expands to compete with Kazakhstan’s dominant financial players.】

item.title: 以色列对沙特协议持更怀疑态度，因战略调整
item.description: 以色列日益怀疑能否在短期内实现与沙特阿拉伯关系正常化，因沙特扩大防务合作并对抗以色列盟友阿联酋的举动被视为敌对行为，令其深感失望。【原文：Israel is increasingly doubtful it can normalize relations with Saudi Arabia any time soon, dismayed by what it sees as hostile moves by the kingdom to expand its defense ties and confront the United Arab Emirates, an Israeli ally.】

item.title: 麦德龙债券在削减债务后反弹，与金树资本达成股权交易
item.description: 麦克赛达DIY控股公司债券价格飙升，此前该公司与债权人达成协议，将削减债务并从现有股东之一金树资产管理公司获得新股本融资。【原文：Maxeda DIY Holding’s bonds jumped after the company reached a deal with creditors to cut its debt and raise new equity from Goldentree Asset Management, one of its existing shareholders.】

item.title: 班科大师银行的失败求购方申请破产保护
item.description: 巴西菲克托控股公司（Fictor Holding SA）在尝试收购大师银行（Banco Master SA）不到三个月后申请破产保护，这源于目标银行去年11月清算引发的连锁反应持续发酵。【原文：Brazil’s Fictor Holding SA filed for bankruptcy protection less than three months after trying to buy Banco Master SA, as fallout spreads from the target bank’s liquidation in November.】

item.title: 美国企业猛烈抨击波兰财政部数字服务税计划
item.description: 美国企业批评波兰数字事务部实施数字服务税的计划，称该计划将不公平地针对该国部分最大外国投资者。【原文：US companies criticized a plan by Poland’s Digital Affairs Ministry to implement a digital services tax, saying it would unfairly target some of the country’s biggest foreign investors.】

item.title: 中国率先出台全球首项安全政策：禁止汽车隐藏式车门把手
item.description: 中国禁止电动汽车使用隐藏式门把手，成为全球首个禁止这种设计的主管部门。该设计由特斯拉公司推广普及，如今因多起致命事故而面临全球监管审查。【原文：China banned concealed door handles on electric vehicles, the first country in the world to outlaw a design popularized by Tesla Inc. that is now facing global regulatory scrutiny due to a spate of deadly incidents.】

item.title: 甲骨文启动美元债券发售，投身人工智能融资热潮
item.description: 甲骨文公司已启动美元债券发行计划，这家软件巨头计划通过债务与股权销售相结合的方式筹集450亿至500亿美元资金，用于扩建云基础设施容量。【原文：Oracle Corp. has kicked off a US dollar bond offering as the software giant looks to raise $45 billion to $50 billion through a combination of debt and equity sales to build additional cloud infrastructure capacity.】

item.title: 纽约市交通局宣布斥资120亿美元更新老旧列车和巴士
item.description: 纽约市公共交通系统——全美规模最大的交通网络——正组建新部门，主导一项耗资120亿美元的计划，旨在更换使用数十年的列车并实现公交车队的现代化升级。【原文：New York City’s transit system, the largest in the US, is creating a new unit to steer a $12 billion effort to replace decades-old trains and modernize its bus fleet.】

item.title: 重组领域巨头联手推出Ensis Partners
item.description: 重组领域重量级人物马克·布施曼和理查德·辛德已创立一家新咨询公司，专门为陷入财务困境的中高端市场企业提供服务。【原文：Restructuring heavyweights Mark Buschmann and Richard Shinder have started a new advisory firm targeting upper-middle market companies in financial distress.】

item.title: 摩根大通称人工智能引领家族办公室投资主题
item.description: 摩根大通私人银行的一项调查显示，人工智能已成为全球家族办公室投资的首要选择，但实际配置比例仍相对滞后，且主要集中于公开市场股票。【原文：Artificial intelligence tops the investment priority list for family offices globally, a survey from JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s private bank shows, though allocations lag and remain concentrated in public equities.】
